intro: Paragonis grandiflora, commonly known as the grandiflora paragonis, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It is characterized by its large, showy flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink and white. The plant has a shrub-like growth habit with woody stems and lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are known to attract a variety of pollinators, including bees and butterflies. It thrives in warm, humid climates and requires well-drained soil for optimal growth.
